text: Remy Arnod is a French para-alpine skier. He represented France at the 1976 Winter Paralympics, at the 1980 Winter Paralympics and at the 1984 Winter Paralympics. In total he won three bronze medals in alpine skiing: two at the 1976 Winter Paralympics and one at the 1980 Winter Paralympics. == Achievements == {| class="wikitable" width=65% style="font-size:90%; text- align:center;" |- !Year !!Competition !!Location !!Position !!Event !!Time |- | rowspan=2 | 1976 | rowspan=2 | 1976 Winter Paralympics | rowspan=2 | Örnsköldsvik, Sweden | bgcolor=cc9966 | 3rd | Giant Slalom II | 2:50.97 |- | bgcolor=cc9966 | 3rd | Alpine Combination II | 1:17.35 |- | 1980 | 1980 Winter Paralympics | Geilo, Norway | bgcolor=cc9966 | 3rd | Slalom 2A | 1:39.51 |} == See also == * List of Paralympic medalists in alpine skiing == References == == External links == * Category:Living people Category:Year of birth missing (living people) Category:Place of birth missing (living people) Category:Paralympic alpine skiers of France Category:Alpine skiers at the 1976 Winter Paralympics Category:Alpine skiers at the 1980 Winter Paralympics Category:Alpine skiers at the 1984 Winter Paralympics Category:Medalists at the 1976 Winter Paralympics Category:Medalists at the 1980 Winter Paralympics Category:Paralympic bronze medalists for France Category:Paralympic medalists in alpine skiing
title: Remy Arnod
